intro: Veronica officinalis var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth speedwell, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and slightly hairy. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and can be found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
